intro: Laserpitium hispidum, commonly known as the hairy hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers consist of yellow disk florets surrounded by yellow to brown ray florets. Laserpitium hispidum is often found in open habitats and is relatively hardy, though it may require some moisture to thrive.
